history.content: You will most likely get into both classes. Lower division CS classes tend to be pretty accommodating toward undeclared CS students because they know students need to take these classes to declare. Just Phase 1 both the classes and you should be good to go.

children.subject: I just researched this issue. If you are an L&S CS transfer student, you should meet the reserve requirements for 70 and 61C and should not be waitlisted. I was also waitlisted in 70 but after emailing a CS enrollment advisor about it, she was able to manually enroll me from the waitlist.
What was the email of the scheduler that helped you? I'm in the same boat but I'm new to the college so I'm not sure how it works.
This is where I sent my email: cs-scheduling@eecs.berkeley.edu  It's not to any particular enrollment manager. Just provide them with your SID and they should be able to help you resolve the issue.

I'm in the same boat, but wondering how we don't meet any reserve requirements. According to the priority rules for L&S transfer students (https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy#lower), shouldn't we be able to enroll in a lower division CS class during Phase 1 as long as there is room?

history.content: So I'm an undeclared L&S CS transfer student going into my third semester here, and my plan was to declare after my third semester and graduate after 5 semesters. To be on track, I need to take both of these classes next semester, but I can't enroll, because there are reserved seats and I guess I don't meet any reserve requirements. So I'm just on the waitlist for both classes now, and I was wondering what my chances are for actually getting in. Is there any way to improve my chances? I'm not sure what I'm supposed to do if I can't get into both classes. Thanks!
history.subject: CS70 and CS61C Waitlists
